Question: How does the property of inertia affect the motion of an object?
Answer: Inertia causes an object to maintain its state of motion, whether it is at rest or in motion. The more massive the object, the greater its inertia.

Friction arises when surfaces rub against each other. It acts as a resistance force, converting kinetic energy (motion) into heat, potentially damaging components over time.
